Articles.Content:
I recently found that it was pretty fun making KSP stuff in blender, so I wanted to show them off in the right place, here at the forums
I've used Blender for a couple of years on and off, but never really had a project or anything "serious" to make in it, so it's nice to take these KSP models/renderings a bit more serious.

If you want, you can request a particular part to be made. It would be nice to have a bunch of models to build actual rockets in blender with, so making parts that you *want* to see would just be a bonus for me.

First off, the one I started with. it's a stayputnik probe with an additional details for higher realism. I modelled everything from scratch, which was fun but took a lot of work. 6 intense hours or so
https://www.dropbox.com/s/umuoz0tvs0b3i5s/untitled.png?dl=0
Hires version with added light brightness: https://www.dropbox.com/s/dludihlon7qisrz/probeHR.jpg?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/mjngntkrbmfd1od/solar.png?dl=0

Later I tried making the rest of the rocket like I use to, again, everything modelled, nothing imported from the game.
https://www.dropbox.com/s/ioexi0m1v5nx4dt/ship01.jpg?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/iimvw14zvckoiek/engine.jpg?dl=0

but then I went 'Meh' and created the IONprobe instead, still no importing. I was happy with this one.
https://www.dropbox.com/s/tse3ou5z4ud21gq/ion2.jpg?dl=0

And THEN I actually imported the science lab but it'd be such a drag to model it all from scratch, so I used the model as a base and improved upon it, adding realistic windows, materials, bevels etc, about 50k polygons in the end, totally manageble.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/w8fc5nae135dfgc/science%20lab2.png?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/7yz0ozipbc61cgf/science%20lab3.png?dl=0


Then, lastly, I tried making the fun-tire of go-fasts, and it took a lot of work, almost not worth it, but hey, squad puts a lot of work into their stuff to, and I wanna get professional some day..
https://www.dropbox.com/s/xmabm8b56gnbzp5/tyreHF1.png?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/g8lisj5l4sdtzn8/tyreHF2.png?dl=0
The tyre was imported from the game, cleaned up (a lot), and added a whole bunch of details and materials etc.


I made all of these in a weekend, which is actually pretty mental for being me, but I was highly enthusiastic at the time. Mildly put.

So yeah, here ya go :B

Edited April 9, 2016 by Bluustreak

Oh, alright. Haven't checked out the pictures yet, but I will.

Do you plan on creating mods out of these models some day?

14 minutes ago, Hysterrics said:

Oh, alright. Haven't checked out the pictures yet, but I will.

Do you plan on creating mods out of these models some day?

Nah, they're basically the stock parts, just visually more refined.
These are quite nice! And hand-made too, very impressive.

Thankyee

Here's a a simple animation I did to show of the wheel a bit more.
https://www.dropbox.com/s/9vhrojlhj5xo8w8/0001-0080.avi?dl=0

It somehow looked more awesome when I created the wheel, but that's a common thing when doing art-or-such. Things often look worse the day after.
